Terms and Conditions for Hotel Reservation

  1. Booking and Confirmation: By making a reservation through our website, you agree to the terms and conditions stated herein. The reservation is considered confirmed once you receive a booking confirmation email.
  2. Payment: Payment for the reservation will be processed at the time of booking. We accept major credit cards and online payment methods. All charges are in the local currency and include applicable taxes and fees.
  3. Cancellation and Refunds: Cancellation policies may vary depending on the rate plan and the specific hotel. Please refer to the cancellation policy stated during the booking process. Refunds, if applicable, will be processed according to the cancellation policy.
  4. Check-in and Check-out: Check-in time is from [time] onwards, and check-out time is before [time]. Early check-in or late check-out requests are subject to availability and may incur additional charges.
  5. Guest Responsibility: It is your responsibility to provide accurate and complete information during the reservation process. Any changes or modifications to the reservation should be communicated to the hotel in a timely manner.
  6. Hotel Policies: During your stay, you are expected to adhere to the hotel's policies and regulations, including but not limited to noise levels, smoking restrictions, and pet policies. Failure to comply may result in additional charges or termination of your reservation.
  7. Identification and Registration: You will be required to present a valid government-issued identification document, such as a passport or driver's license, during check-in. The hotel reserves the right to refuse check-in if proper identification is not provided.
  8. Guest Conduct: Guests are expected to conduct themselves in a respectful and responsible manner during their stay. Any disruptive or inappropriate behavior may lead to eviction from the hotel without refund.
  9. Liability and Damages: The university and the hotel shall not be held liable for any loss, damage, or theft of personal belongings during your stay. It is recommended to use the in-room safe or the hotel's safety deposit box for valuable items.
  10. Force Majeure: The university and the hotel shall not be responsible for any failure or delay in performing their obligations due to circumstances beyond their control, including but not limited to natural disasters, acts of terrorism, or government restrictions.
